Response: Your explanation was very clear and well thought out; however the level of interaction was low. It may have been better to let us struggle with a few of these concepts with each other from time to time to increase the level of interaction and  foreground questions.

I didn't fully understand the utility of the f statistic. I like the simple heuristic of modeling as a process of increasing accuracy while minimizing complexity, but I didn't fully understand why it's important to minimize complexity. A short explanation might fix things for me.
I liked the wraparound way of getting to a t-test...too often I just assume I know what it's doing and I don't. But I found it difficult to understand this interpretation of an F statistic
I really liked this class. I really liked the general procedure that Tobi explained.
Hope we cover degrees of freedom.
I found the modeling-based approach very intuitive and I think it helped me understand the conceptual basis of statistical testing more so than other classes I've taken. Thanks.

I liked that you included poll questions every few slides, to keep us engaged! That said, the last two poll questions were very confusing and made it clear to me that I did not really understand the material....
I like how we build up from the basic blocks. maybe talk about how the central limit theorem is a good approximation for i.i.d observations??
Love how scaffolded the lessons were. Clearest statistics lecture to date.
Today's class was very informative, but I think it would have been helpful to see the simulations (such as the one described at the end of the lecture) done in class.
Really enjoyed the thorough explanations. Thank you!
I think the lecture is still too theoretical with not enough concrete examples....it makes it hard to follow.
This was a really intuitive way of thinking about statistical tests that I hadn't considered before :)
